Interface Field

All Superinterfaces:
Variable
public interface Field extends Variable
Represents a field accessible by the body of a method. Note that the most commonly used features are inherited from the Variable interface.
See Also:
  • MethodMaker.field(String)

    default Field
    name(String name)
    Fields cannot be renamed, and so this method always throws an IllegalStateException.

    signature(Object... components)
    Fields cannot have a signature defined within the body of a method, and so this method always throws an IllegalStateException.

    • name

      default Field name(String name)
      Fields cannot be renamed, and so this method always throws an IllegalStateException.
      Specified by:
      name in interface Variable
      Returns:
      this variable

    • signature

      default Field signature(Object... components)
      Fields cannot have a signature defined within the body of a method, and so this method always throws an IllegalStateException.
      Specified by:
      signature in interface Variable
      Returns:
      this

    • set

      Field set(Object value)
      Assign a value to this variable, either from another variable or from a constant. A constant value can be a primitive type (boxed or unboxed), null, a String, a Class, an Enum, a MethodType, a MethodHandleInfo, a ConstantDesc, or a Constable.

      Note that a MethodHandle can be set with a MethodHandleInfo, which is converted automatically at link time. Handling of ConstantDesc and Constable is also treated specially — the actual type is determined by the resolved constant.

      Specified by:
      set in interface Variable
      Parameters:
      value - a Variable or a constant
      Returns:
      this variable

    • varHandle

      Variable varHandle()
      Returns a VarHandle variable which accesses the field. If this is an ordinary field, the variable is actually a constant, and so it can be supplied as an argument to a bootstrap method or be used by another method in the same class. For non-static fields, the first VarHandle coordinate is the object instance which owns the field. Static fields have no coordinates.

    • methodHandleSet

      Variable methodHandleSet()
      Returns a MethodHandle variable for setting the field value. If this is an ordinary field, the variable is actually a constant, and so it can be supplied as an argument to a bootstrap method or be used by another method in the same class. For non-static fields, the MethodHandle accepts two arguments: the object instance which owns the field, and the value to set. For static fields, the only argument is the value to set.

    • methodHandleGet

      Variable methodHandleGet()
      Returns a MethodHandle variable for getting the field value. If this is an ordinary field, the variable is actually a constant, and so it can be supplied as an argument to a bootstrap method or be used by another method in the same class. For non-static fields, the MethodHandle accepts one argument: the object instance which owns the field. For static fields, there are no arguments.
